name: Little Red Riding Hood (Red)
traits: Curious, independent, brave, compassionate, naïve, determined
background: Young girl living with her mother near the forest; close relationship with her grandmother. Has grown up with stories and warnings about the dangers in the woods.
motivation: To prove her independence and care for her sick grandmother, while striving to do the right thing and keep her family safe.

name: The Wolf
traits: Cunning, manipulative, deceptive, predatory, intelligent, ruthless
background: A dangerous predator in the forest, skilled at imitating voices and disguising intentions. Familiar with human habits and vulnerabilities.
motivation: To satisfy his hunger by preying on Red and her grandmother, using trickery and disguise to achieve his ends.

name: Red's Mother
background: Single mother raising Red on the edge of the forest; has deep-seated fears about the dangers present, especially wolves.
motivation: To protect Red from the dangers of the woods and ensure her safety by enforcing rules and warnings.

name: Grandma
background: Elderly woman living alone in a cottage deeper in the forest; frequently visited by Red and her family.
motivation: To recover from her illness and see her granddaughter, relying on family for companionship and support.

name: The Huntsman
background: Local woodsman familiar with the forest’s dangers; known for helping villagers and keeping the area safe.
motivation: To protect the villagers (including Red and Grandma) from predators, uphold safety in the woods, and confront danger without hesitation.

name: Villagers
background: Residents of the village near the forest, familiar with stories of wolves and the risks posed by the woods.
motivation: To keep their community safe, respond to threats, and support one another in times of danger.
